column3: Department of Social and Policy Sciences
column5: Explore global development by focusing on economic concepts, such as social identity, collective action, power relations, and psychological biases.If you are interested in studying the part-time version of this course, please visit our website.During this master’s you’ll address the contemporary challenges of global economic development.You’ll adopt a multifaceted focus to analyse the real-world impacts of economic policy. This will allow you to see how the assumptions of economic theory can differ from lived reality, especially in impoverished communities.This course is influenced by Bath’s longstanding engagement in international development and applied economic analysis. You’ll critically assess real-world case studies to draw links across global, regional, national and local scales.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
